page.title: 05Allers Works-NE.of Tiverton
page.content: There has been a water supply scheme at Allers Farm since 1886.At that time water was taken from the Town Leat and supplied to most of the houses in Tiverton. In 1939 extra water was added to the supply at Allers Works and This came from the River Exe at Bolham. The new Allers Works was started in 1969 and completed in June 1971. The area covers twenty acres and three people work there. The water for Allers Works nowadays comes from the springs at Allers,the River Exe at Bolham and the old Town Leat. The water passes from the works into one of three underground reservoirs within the area.
